intro: Gaultheria glandulifera, commonly known as the sticky saxifrage, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves that are often covered in glandular dots, giving them a sticky texture. Its flowers are typically white or pink, appearing in clusters and blooming in the spring. Gaultheria glandulifera is adapted to grow in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
